content.title: Groin Wound Complications
content.definition: Surgical site complications following vascular surgery in the groin, including infection, lymphatic leak, hematoma, and wound dehiscence.

concepts.definition: Surgical site infection in groin incisions.

clinical_features.risk_factors: Obesity, diabetes, tissue loss, redo surgery

clinical_features.lymphocele: Collection of lymph in surgical bed
clinical_features.mechanism: Disruption of inguinal lymphatics during dissection
clinical_features.prevention: Careful lymphatic ligation, avoid femoral triangle

concepts.definition: How to reduce groin wound complications.

clinical_features.significance: Major source of morbidity in vascular surgery
